content.description: Sit start with a left hand on the arete and a right on a vertical rail. From there, climbs straight up using the arete and generous edges to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad will work well. The landing is flat and clear.
content.location: It climbs the west side of Blanc's northwest arete.

content.description: Sit start with a pair of edges and a good left foot. From there, work straight up through edges and bumps to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad will work, the landing is fantastic.
content.location: It climbs the eastern section of Blanc's south face.

content.description: Sit start with a left hand edge and a right hand undercling. From there, work through the small edges to a left hand two-finger pocket and a good right hand edge, gain a left hand sidepull, reach a right hand crimp, stick the lip, and mantel on top.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work well. The landing is flat and clear.
content.location: It climbs the center of Blanc's west face.

content.description: Sit start with a left hand on the arete and a right hand edge. From there, gain a right hand pinch-edge, bump the left hand up the arete, reach a right hand edge, paste a high left foot, make a big right hand move to an edge, finish up the remaining bumps for an easy mantel.
content.protection: Pair of pads will work well. Good landing.
content.location: It climbs the south side of Blanc's southwest arete.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on the smile-shaped edge. From there, climb up and slightly left on a pocket and edges, then go straight up for the finish.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work well. The landing is quite good.
content.location: It climbs the center of Blanc's south face.

content.description: Sit start with a low, left hand edge and a right hand on the arete. From there, flag the right foot while balanced on a poor left smear, bump the right hand up the arete, gain a left hand edge, bump the left hand into a good sidepull-undercling, bump the right hand further up the arete, gain a great edge with the left hand, then make a big move to the false lip. Follow the lip up and left to top it out.
content.protection: A pad will work fine. The landing is great.
content.location: It climbs the west side of Blanc's southwest arete.
